metadata.title: CVE-2015-7830 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The pcapng_read_if_descr_block function in wiretap/pcapng.c in the pcapngparser in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.8 uses too many levels of pointerindirection, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(incorrect free and application crash) via a crafted packet that triggersinterface-filter copying.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7830` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
